intro: Acetosa paucifolia, commonly known as the few-leaved sorrel, is a low-growing perennial plant native to arctic and alpine regions. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often edible leaves. The plant typically has a compact rosette of fleshy, spoon-shaped leaves that are covered in a fine layer of white hairs. It produces small, greenish flowers that grow in clusters, and it thrives in cool, moist environments. Acetosa paucifolia is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported health benefits.
